section.title: &kw-hos-tm; &kw-hos-version-50;: Replacing Drives in a Swift Node

abstract.para:
Maintenance steps for replacing drives in a Swift node.
This process is used when you want to remove a remove a failed hard drive from Swift node and replace it with a new one.There are two different classes of drives in a Swift node that needs to be replaced; the operating system disk drive (generally /dev/sda) and storage disk drives. There are different procedures for the replacement of each class of drive to bring the node back to normal.

sidebar.title: To Replace the Operating System Disk Drive
sidebar.para: After the operating system disk drive is replaced, the node must be reimaged.

listitem.para: Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Reimage the node using this playbook:
listitem.screen: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml -e nodelist=<server name>

Review the cloudConfig.yml and data/control_plane.yml files to get the host prefix (for example, helion) and the control plane name (for example, cp1). This gives you the hostname of the node. Configure the operating system:
In the following example, for swobj2, the hostname is helion-cp1-swobj0002:
If this is the first server running the swift-proxy service, restore the Swift Ring Builder files to the /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir directory. (For more information and instructions, see .)
Configure services on the node using the hlm-deploy.yml playbook. If you have used an encryption password when running the configuration processor include the --ask-vault-pass argument.

sidebar.title: To Replace a Storage Disk Drive
sidebar.para: After a storage drive is replaced, there is no need to reimage the server. Instead, run the swift-reconfigure.yml playbook.
